results.title: The Last detail
results.creator_credit: Hal Ashby, Gerald Ayres and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Jack Nicholson stars in another outstanding performance as a hard-bitten professional Navy-man given the loathsome job of escortinga very young sailor to a military prison for a minor crime. Randy Quaid, as the young man, hasn’t begun to live yet, so Nicholson decides to give him a lifetime of experiences in three days!. This results in a drinking, fighting, womanising binge, unparalleled in movie history.

results.title: Red river
results.brief_description: Director Howard Hawks’ classic western stars the legendary John Wayne at the peak of his career and Montgomery Clift in his screen debut. Walter Brennan heads the outstanding supporting cast. The film is an account of the first cattle drive over the Chisholm Trail, from deep Texas to Abilene, Kansas. Authentic detail and stunning cinematography bring to life the trials and tribulations of this extraordinary challenge for the men who battled the dust, rain, heat and frustration of the long, hard drive. The demands of this rigorous journey further strain the edgy relationship between the film’s key characters. Tom Dunson (Wayne) is a self-made cattle king whose single-mindedness has turned him into a cold-blooded executioner, ruthlessly determined to take the cattle to Abilene his way. Arguably the best western ever made, “Red River” captures both the grandeur of the early West and the sheer determination of its people.

results.title: Hans Christian Andersen
results.creator_credit: Charles Vidor, Samuel Goldwyn and Samuel Goldwyn Productions
results.brief_description: The incredibly multi-talented Danny Kaye stars as Hans Christian Andersen, a young cobbler with a special gift for storytelling. We first see Hans in his home town of Odense, Denmark, entertaining the village children with his fascinating tales - much to the displeasure of the schoolmaster. Hans takes off for Copenhagen where he falls hopelessly in love with a ballerina, only to discover she is already married. However, this unrequited love inspires a spectacular 17 minute ballet, “The Little Mermaid”, that is one of the highlights of the film. Finally Hans returns home to the acclaim of his fellow townsfolk. Nominated for six Academy Awards, it is a visual and musical delight with an imaginative score. You will be enchanted by this entertaining and much-loved family film that has delighted both young and old for over forty years.

results.title: Frankie and Johnny
results.creator_credit: Garry Marshall, Nick Abdo and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: This warm romantic comedy stars Michelle Pfeiffer as Frankie, a cynical waitress who is wooed by the gentle Johnny (Al Pacino), a recently released pretty criminal who takes a job as a chef in the restaurant in which Frankie works. Set around the working class neighbourhoods of New York City, the film is an engaging comedy about the fears and difficulties involved in learning to trust another person. Terrence McNally wrote the script which is based on his acclaimed play, “Frankie and Johnny in the Clair de Lune”. One of the great joys of this film are the uniformly excellent performances. The cast includes Kate Nelligan as Frankie’s fellow waitress; Nathan Lane as her generous spirited gay flat-mate; and the under-rated Hector Helizondo as Nick, the owner of the Greek restaurant in which Frankie and Johnny work.

results.title: The Last picture show
results.creator_credit: Peter Bogdanovich, Stephen J. Friedman, BBS Productions and Columbia
results.brief_description: Released in 1971 to critical acclaim and public controversy, this modern day classic directed by Peter Bogdanovich garnered eight Academy Award nominations (including Best Picture). It was hailed as “the most important work by a young director since Citizen Kane”. A frank, bittersweet drama of social and sexual mores in small-town Texas featuring a cast led by Timothy Bottoms, Jeff Bridges and Cybill Shepherd in her debut role. Cloris Leachman and Ben Johnson each won Oscars for their work in supporting roles. The characters created by Larry McMurty in his compelling novel are vividly brought to life in one of the most engaging coming-of-age stories ever filmed.

results.title: River's edge
results.creator_credit: Tim Hunter, Midge Sanford, Sarah Pillsbury and Hemdale Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This film is a story of today’s teenagers poised perilously on the brink between adolescence and adulthood. When one of them murders his girl-friend, the others must decide for themselves which is more important - admitting knowledge of a dreadful deed, or staying loyal to a close friend. They do not know how to react and their plight is one with which everyone - young and old - can identify. It is an extraordinary document of teen life today, showing how adolescents can seem almost numbed by even the most intense, extreme situations. This film is disturbing, thought-provoking and based on a real-life incident. WARNING: SOME SCENES IN THIS FILM MAY BE DISTURBING TO SOME VIEWERS.

results.title: The Outlaw Josey Wales
results.creator_credit: Clint Eastwood, Robert Daley and Malpaso Company
results.brief_description: Josey Wales (Clint Eastwood) becomes physically and emotionally scarred when Union gorillas murder his family and destroy his Missouri farm. Turning vigilante and ending up with a price on his head, he journeys to Texas and becomes a much-feared Confederate raider. Wales becomes the unwilling centre of a loose community when he picks up survivors of a wagon train ambushed by Comancheros (engagingly played by an excellent supporting cast which includes Sondra Locke). Ultimately, Wales can’t bring himself to leave his motley surrogate family unprotected. Eastwood had not intended to direct as well as star in his twenty-sixth feature film. The directorial assignment had been given to co-writer Phil Kaufman who exited from the picture early on during location shooting and Eastwood, taking over, performed a first-rate job. The film also received an Academy Award nomination for music.

results.title: Alfie
results.creator_credit: Lewis Gilbert and Sheldrake Films Ltd
results.brief_description: This wonderful comedy is the film that catapulted Michael Caine to stardom. Alfie (Caine) is not really a bad sort. He’s just a philandering cockney playboy who has this overwhelming desire for the opposite sex. What’s more, he likes to brag about his conquests, and he doesn’t have to exaggerate, because Alfie gets them all; fat, thin, blonde, brunette, young and even the older ‘richer’ woman. He’s just irresistible, no one can beat him at the mating game! This is Michael Caine at his chauvinistic best. Also stars Shelly Winters as Ruby. Based on the play by Bill Naughton.

results.title: Love among the ruins
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Allan Davis, Star Video and ABC Video Enterprises
results.brief_description: In London, 1911, a prestigious London barrister (Laurence Olivier) is defending an ageing actress (Katherine Hepburn), from a breach of promise suit brought by a young gigolo who claims she trifled with his affections and reneged on her promise to marry him. The stiff collar barrister and his client were lovers years ago. Hepburn and Olivier give love a touch of class and received Emmy Awards for their performances. Similarly recognised was the sensitive direction by George Cukor (his TV movie debut) and the writing of James Costigan. Co-starring Colin Blakely, Richard Pearson, Joan Sims and Leigh Lawson. Based on the novel by Angela Thirkell.

results.title: Whistle down the wind
results.creator_credit: Bryan Forbes, Richard Attenborough and Beaver Films
results.brief_description: Based on Mary Hayley Bell’s popular novel, this is a charming and thoughtful study of the fragile nature of childhood trusts and beliefs. Hayley Mills and Alan Bates give excellent performances in this story of three innocent children who find a fugitive from the law in their barn and believe that he is Jesus. Produced by award-winning Richard Attenborough, this film is a poignant unveiling of the children’s gradual understanding of the truth, which will delight adults and children alike.
